plugins.name: Stopwatch
plugins.description:
A simple stopwatch timer that counts up from zero and continuously updates your selected text layer in real time.

Great for prototyping timers, showing elapsed time, or just tracking activity in your design!


üîß Features:

Live stopwatch with hh:mm:ss format

Start, Stop, and Reset controls

Automatically updates the selected text node in Figma

Lightweight and easy to use


üìö Instructions for Use

  1. Select a text layer in your Figma file
  2. Run the plugin: Plugins ‚Üí Stopwatch Timer
  3. Click Start to begin counting up
  4. The time will update in your selected layer every second
  5. Use Stop to pause or Reset to clear the timer


üìù Note: Make sure the text node uses a single font like ‚ÄúInter Semi Bold‚Äù. The plugin automatically loads the required font.
plugins.tagline: A simple stopwatch that updates your Figma layers in real time.

plugins.name: FigJam Export to Markdown or JSON
plugins.description:
Turn sticky-note chaos into structured documentation.


This plugin reads your FigJam board, detects heading hierarchies by the number of ‚≠ê star stamps on each card, and exports a clean outline ‚Äì perfect for journey-maps, service blueprints, research affinity walls or any workshop board that needs to become a report.


What you get

‚Ä¢ Markdown or JSON with true heading levels (H1 / H2 / ‚Ä¶).

‚Ä¢ Bullet lists for every sticky-note or text card.

‚Ä¢ Embedded screenshots and photos ‚Äì automatically resized, placed under the right heading and zipped into an assets/ folder.

‚Ä¢ One-click download; whole page or just the frames you select.


How it works

1 Structure top-down

Place headings above their content; the heading‚Äôs width defines the column below it.

2 Stamp to mark hierarchy

3 identical stars = H1,‚ÄÉ2 stars = H2,‚ÄÉ1 or 0 = regular content.

(Stars sitting on an image are ignored.)

3 Click ‚ÄúDownload MD‚Äù or ‚ÄúDownload JSON‚Äù

Text-only boards produce a single file; boards with images are delivered as a ready-to-share .zip.


Stop rebuilding journey maps slide-by-slide. Export once, drop the Markdown into Notion, Confluence or GitHub ‚Äì or feed the JSON into your own reporting pipeline.
plugins.tagline: From FigJam to finished journey-map reports in one click ‚Äì stamp, export, done.

plugins.name: Voice to Text for Figma
plugins.description:
Easily insert text into Figma using your voice!

Click ‚ÄúOpen Voice Tool‚Äù ‚Üí Start speaking in the browser ‚Üí Your speech will be transcribed and automagically added into your selected Figma text layer.

No typing. Just talking.


‚úÖ Use Case 1:

‚ÄúTired of switching between docs and Figma just to copy-paste written content?‚Äù

Speak directly into the plugin‚Äôs voice tool and instantly push the transcription into your selected text box‚Äîno tab switching, no distractions.


‚úÖ Use Case 2:

‚ÄúWant to insert longer text into your Figma design without typing it all out?‚Äù

Use Voice to Text for Figma to dictate your content and have it transcribed directly into your design‚Äîperfect for mockups, user flows, or note-taking during brainstorming.


Supported Features & Limits:

‚úÖ Languages Supported: English, Arabic, Chinese (Simplified), Dutch, French, German, Hindi, Italian, Japanese, Korean, Portuguese, Russian, Spanish

üïê Time Limit: Records up to 60 seconds per session, auto-warns you before timeout

üåê Browser Compatibility:

‚úÖ Supported: Google Chrome, Safari, Opera, Samsung Internet

‚ö†Ô∏è Partially Supported: Microsoft Edge, Firefox

‚ùå Not Supported: Internet Explorer, Brave, Arc

üß† Auto-restart: On silence to ensure smoother capture

üéô Microphone Permission : Detects and guidance for Mac & Windows users.

üñ•Ô∏è Figma Compatibility: Works seamlessly on both Figma Browser and Figma Desktop / Mac App

‚úÖ Accessibility Enhancements

‚ù§Ô∏è Open Source Code: https://github.com/mryeshwanth/voice-figma-plugin


How it works:

  1. When you click Open Voice Tool, a new browser window will open to start recording.
  2. This is required because Figma Mac/Desktop plugins can‚Äôt access your microphone directly.
  3. The tool uses your browser's built-in Web Speech API (SpeechRecognition) to transcribe your voice locally ‚Äî nothing is sent to any external server.
  4. Once done, the transcription is securely sent back to the Figma plugin and inserted into your selected text node.
plugins.tagline: Convert your voice to text, directly into Figma.

plugins.name: WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker (SC 1.4.4) for Design Systems
plugins.description:
The WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker plugin designed to help you ensure that your design system components comply with SC 1.4.4: Resize Text (Level AA). This plugin helps verify that all text elements within your Figma designs behave appropriately when resized to 200% of their original size.


Key Features:

  1. 200% Text Resize: Duplicates the selected element and automatically applies 200% text resize to all text layers of the selected element.
  2. All Component Checking: Works with text layers, groups, frames, auto-layout, and any other elements.
  3. Line Height Adjustments: Allows you to update the line height according to the new size, or ignore it.
plugins.tagline: Check the behavior of your design system components according to the 200% text resize (WCAG 2.2)

124999.name: WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker (SC 1.4.4) for Design Systems
124999.description:
The WCAG 2.2 Text Resize Checker plugin designed to help you ensure that your design system components comply with SC 1.4.4: Resize Text (Level AA). This plugin helps verify that all text elements within your Figma designs behave appropriately when resized to 200% of their original size.


Key Features:

  1. 200% Text Resize: Duplicates the selected element and automatically applies 200% text resize to all text layers of the selected element.
  2. All Component Checking: Works with text layers, groups, frames, auto-layout, and any other elements.
  3. Line Height Adjustments: Allows you to update the line height according to the new size, or ignore it.
124999.tagline: Check the behavior of your design system components according to the 200% text resize (WCAG 2.2)

plugins.name: Twenty3 Template Tagging
plugins.description:
Export graphics for the Twenty3 Toolbox.


How to use:

  1. Start by installing the Twenty3 Template Tagging plugin from the Resources tab in Figma
  2. Select the Frame or Layer that you would like to export
  3. Check the preview in the plugin interface
  4. Click the export button in the plugin header to save the formatted SVG locally
  5. Upload the SVG at https://toolbox.twenty3.sport/graphic-editor using your Toolbox credentials


Technical details:

  1. SVG text elements are replaced with foreignObject elements so that text can be populated dynamically and manually in the Toolbox editor
  2. Figma's image rect elements are replaced with and image tag containing base64 encoded data


Notes:

  1. Font binding takes place in the Toolbox, so if you do not have the fonts downloaded to your device you will not see them in the preview
plugins.tagline: Software to format and export templates for the Twenty3 Toolbox

- Real-time preview


üé® Full Customization

- Adjustable size and margin

- Dark/Light mode support

- Add your brand logo to QR codes

Use Cases

plugins.name: Figma to Azure
plugins.description:
Crete Azure work items without leaving Figma.


Key Features

  1. One-Click Creation: Select any Figma component to generate an Azure Board item.
  2. Automatic Previews: Visuals attach directly to the work item.
  3. Direct Linking: Clickable links between Azure work items and components.
  4. Custom Field Mapping: Match your Azure setup with flexible field configs.
  5. Team Area Support: Organize work in your project‚Äôs structure.
  6. Smart Field Detection: Autofills required Azure fields.


Why Teams Use It

  1. Save time‚Äîno more screenshots or copy-paste.
  2. Developers get full visual context.
  3. Sync design and dev workflows effortlessly.
  4. Keep everything traceable and connected.


How to Get Started

  1. Select a Figma component
  2. Add your Azure Personal Access Token (requires Read & Write access for work items)
  3. Enter your Azure DevOps URL
  4. Customize the item
  5. Click Create


That‚Äôs it‚Äîthe plugin handles previews, links, and field setup for you.

plugins.name: SupaFastPages
plugins.description:
This plugin helps designers and teams using Figma to automatically convert sections in a design into separate pages. This can be especially useful when you want to organise your Figma document by moving grouped content (like artboards or frames in a section) into new individual pages.


Key Features:

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
plugins.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

1. Convert Sections to Pages: The plugin scans the current Figma document and identifies sections (grouped content marked by Figma as "sections"). For each section it finds, the plugin creates a new page with the same name as the section or a default name if none is provided.

2. Move Children to New Pages: It transfers all the child nodes (like frames, components, and groups) inside the section to the newly created page. This helps in better organization and management of design files, where each section is neatly placed into its own page.

3. Remove Empty Sections: Once the children are moved to the new page, the original section is removed, leaving the workspace clean and organized.
109166.release_notes:
1. UI Adjustments and Styling

‚Ä¢Dialog Box Sizing: Set the dimensions explicitly using figma.showUI(__html__, { width: 260, height: 320 }) in code.ts to ensure the interface displays without scrolling.
‚Ä¢Glassmorphic Background: Updated the container background to use a semi-transparent style with blur and shadow effects, enhancing the visual appeal.
‚Ä¢Font Updates: Applied SF Pro font styling to various elements to maintain a consistent and professional look.

2. Button Behavior Enhancement

‚Ä¢Dynamic Button Text: The Convert button initially displays ‚ÄúSelect an Option‚Äù and is disabled. When the user selects either ‚ÄúSections‚Äù or ‚ÄúFrames,‚Äù the text changes to ‚ÄúConvert,‚Äù and the button becomes enabled.
‚Ä¢Button Style Changes: Updated the styling of the disabled and enabled states of the button to use appropriate gradients and colors, making the active state more visually distinct.

3. Selection Feedback

‚Ä¢Option Selection Toggle: Added visual feedback for option selection. When ‚ÄúSections‚Äù or ‚ÄúFrames‚Äù is selected, it highlights in red while the unselected option remains grey.
‚Ä¢Single Selection at a Time: Ensured that only one option can be selected at a time, with the other being deselected.

4. User Guidance

‚Ä¢Clear Instruction via Button: By changing the button text dynamically based on the selection, the update guides users through the necessary steps (selecting an option) before conversion, improving usability.
109166.tagline: Effortlessly convert sections into organized pages for a cleaner Figma workspace.

The BlocksIn System plugin for Figma is a game-changer for front-end development. Effortlessly convert Figma designs into React components, ready for implementation with our NPM package.

plugins.name: Background Color Generator
plugins.description:
Summary:

This plugin is ideal for B2B products where you want to integrate a client‚Äôs branding color into background designs while maintaining accessibility and strong visual contrast.


How to use:

Pick a color using the hue slider or a HEX code. Select the layer you want to apply the color to, then simply click the button to apply it. The plugin generates light and dark variations with the same hue.


Accessibility Compliance:

This plugin follows the WCAG 2.1 guidelines for color contrast:

  1. The light color is optimized for contrast against 87% black (#161616), and the dark color against white (#FFFFFF).
  2. For normal text (below 18pt bold / 24pt regular), the minimum contrast ratio is 4.5:1.
  3. For large text (18pt bold or 24pt regular and above), the minimum contrast ratio is 3:1.
  4. The generated light and dark color combinations exceed these minimum requirements, ensuring better readability and accessibility for users with visual impairments.


(Note: I made this plugin from Ai integrated in VS code. If you want to know more about what I do at work, you can check Daidai )
plugins.tagline: Color generator for light and dark backgrounds.

plugins.name: Smart Selection
plugins.description:
Smart Selection is a powerful tool for designers that allows flexible filtering of elements based on multiple parameters: dimensions, names, types, properties, and even child element content.


The plugin enables you to:

  1. Filter elements by exact values, ranges, and regular expressions
  2. Find objects with specific child elements
  3. Save, load, and combine sets of selected elements
  4. Export and import selection sets to share between files and teams
  5. Use an intuitive interface with convenient filters


Essential for working with complex designs when you need to quickly find elements with specific characteristics ‚Äî save time on routine selection tasks and start working more efficiently.
plugins.tagline: Advanced element selection by parameters and saving selection sets for quick reuse.

plugins.name: Codex ‚Äî Repository-Aware Code Generator powered by AI
plugins.description:
Codex is an AI powered code generator that learns your existing repo. You can import your repository, and Codex will generate code in your used framework, using your styles and configurations. It works with any framework or language. No setup necessary ‚Äî just import with one click and go!


Features


Code just like you wrote it yourself

Codex will adapt its code generation to the conventions and code style used across your repo. It will read config files and use the same libraries and frameworks you use in your project.


Refine your export further

Need to use a specific component? Instruct Codex to change your code and get a refined result, without losing the context. You can also do this multiple times, until you‚Äôre 100% happy.


Learns your repository with a one-click-import

You don‚Äôt have to map your figma components to your design system. Codex automatically recognizes which components you have implemented or installed and will use those for generating code.


Generates code in any framework or language

Any language, library or framework you are using in your repo will be used by Codex to generate code from Figma.


Learns from your feedback

As you refine your exports, Codex will remember your feedback and apply it to future code generations.


FAQ


Who is it for?

Codex is targeted at professional front end developers to speed up their workflows.


Does my figma file need special preparation?

No, but it works much better if all frames use auto layout.


Which frameworks are supported?

Codex is framework-agnostic. This means it can generate code in any language, for any framework. However, popular frameworks like React and Vue work best, as LLMs have more training data on them.


Can I use it without a repository?

Currently, no. But you can create a repository and initialize it with an empty skeleton in the framework of your choice, then Codex will generate code for that framework.


Does it work with monorepos?

If there is only one frontend package in the repo, likely yes. Better monorepo support is on the roadmap.


Does it only work in dev mode/design mode?

Codex works in both figma modes.


Does it only work with Github?

Currently, yes. Other providers coming soon.


Pricing


Check our pricing page for information on plans.
plugins.tagline: The code generator that understands your repository

plugins.name: Frame Duplicator
plugins.description:
Frame Duplicator is a plugin designed to help designers and social media managers quickly create multiple posts based on CSV data and images. Perfect for batch processing posts for social media, marketing, or any other repetitive content creation tasks.


In a sentence: Choose images and upload a CSV file listing the images and any text you‚Äôd like displayed. This plugin will read your CSV, duplicate a selected frame, and insert the specified images as the background along with the provided text in designated areas.


Key Features:

CSV Integration: Automatically populate frames with text fields such as titles and subtitles based on CSV data, making it easy to maintain consistent content across multiple designs.

Image Replacement: Efficiently replace images in frames based on file names specified in the CSV, allowing you to work seamlessly with visual content.

Aspect Ratio Preservation: Ensures that images maintain their aspect ratio when resized within frames, avoiding distortion or stretching.

Batch Frame Duplication: Create multiple frames with the click of a button, with each frame populated by unique data and images from your CSV.


How to Use:

Prepare CSV and Images: Make sure your CSV file includes columns for text fields (title and subtitle) and image filenames.


Your CSV column titles must be:

title, subtitle, imageName.


Select a Frame in Figma: Choose the frame you want to duplicate.


Your Frame must include text / rectangle elements titled:

##Title ##Image ##Subtitle


Upload CSV and Images: Load your CSV and corresponding image files through the plugin‚Äôs interface.

Create Frames: Click "Create Frames" to generate frames based on the CSV data, with each frame containing unique text and images row by row.
plugins.tagline: Duplicate frames with text and images based on CSV data for streamlined post creation

plugins.name: AutoFrame
plugins.description:
AutoFrame: Connect Airtable Data to Your Figma Designs


Bridge the gap between your data and your designs! Autoframe allows you to seamlessly connect your Airtable bases directly to Figma, automating the creation and synchronization of design elements.


Stop manually copying and pasting data. With Autoframe, you can generate perfectly structured Figma frames populated with real content from your Airtable views, saving you time and reducing errors.


Key Features:

  1. Secure Airtable Connection: Easily connect your Airtable account using a secure OAuth 2.0 flow.
  2. Automated Frame Generation: Select an Airtable Base, Table, and View, and instantly generate Figma frames for each record.
  3. Data-Driven Content: Choose specific Airtable fields to populate text layers within your frames, ensuring your designs reflect your actual data.
  4. Custom Frame Naming: Designate an Airtable field to automatically name your generated frames.
  5. Dynamic Frame Sizing: Optionally add a "Dimensions" field (e.g., 300x500) in your Airtable view to automatically set the width and height of corresponding Figma frames.
  6. Flexible Layout: Control the arrangement of generated frames by specifying the number of columns.
  7. Figma to Airtable: Push text edits or frame name changes made in Figma back to your Airtable base.
  8. Airtable to Figma: Pull the latest data from Airtable to update your existing generated frames without needing to regenerate everything.
  9. Secure Login: Protects access via an Email + One-Time Passcode (OTP) verification system.


How It Works:

  1. Connect: Log in and securely connect your Airtable account.
  2. Select: Choose your Airtable Base, Table, View, and the fields you want to use for frame names and content.
  3. Generate: Click "Generate Frames" to automatically create frames on your Figma canvas populated with your data.
  4. Sync: Use the "Sync Changes to Airtable" or "Sync From Airtable" buttons to keep your designs and data aligned.


Ideal For:

  1. Data-driven design workflows
  2. Managing dynamic content within designs (e.g., user profiles, product cards)
  3. Populating components for design systems
  4. Quickly visualizing data structures from Airtable
  5. Anyone looking to streamline their design process by integrating directly with Airtable.


Get started with AutoFrame today and bring your Airtable data to life in Figma!
plugins.tagline: Autoframe: The Bridge Between Airtable and Figma.
